dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: ...so they're looking at, like, limiting how many people can actually register in a single apartment, you know, in Astana.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so they're looking at, like, limiting how many people can actually register in a single apartment, you know, in Astana.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Astana may introduce a limit on the registration of residents in a single apartment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, okay. Is that, like, really a big deal? Sounds pretty… bureaucratic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, okay. Is that, like, really a big deal? Sounds pretty... bureaucratic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: No, but wait. This isn't just bureaucracy, though. Deputy Prime Minister Zhumangarin, he’s saying it’s because everyone’s just flooding into the big cities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but wait. This isn't just bureaucracy, though. Deputy Prime Minister Zhumangarin, he's saying it's because everyone's just flooding into the big cities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin, the population is increasingly moving to major cities, leading to the problem of so-called "rubber apartments."

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So people move for opportunities. What's the problem there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So people move for opportunities. What's the problem there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: The problem is these "rubber apartments." Owners, uh, they register people for cash, right? But those people don't even live there. It's like, just a ghost address.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The problem is these rubber apartments. Owners, uh, they register people for cash, right? But those people don't even live there. It's like, just a ghost address.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As practice shows, property owners often violate migration laws by registering people at their address for a fee without them actually living there,

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. So it's about, what, migration laws? They want to track people better?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. So it's about, what, migration laws? They want to track people better?

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And the local maslikhat will even decide how many square meters per person. There'll be a ban if you go over that, um, except for family.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And the local maslikhat will even decide how many square meters per person. There'll be a ban if you go over that, um, except for family.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The local maslikhat will determine how many square meters per person are required. A ban on registration beyond this limit will also be introduced. However, these restrictions will not apply when homeowners register their spouses and close relatives,

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no surprise there. Always an exception for family.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no surprise there. Always an exception for family.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Seems like a lot of hassle for… what, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seems like a lot of hassle for... what, exactly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it points to a wider issue, right? Like, eighty villages have disappeared from Kazakhstan’s map in just two years. Eighty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it points to a wider issue, right? Like, eighty villages have disappeared from Kazakhstan's map in just two years. Eighty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, deputy Zhiguli Dairabayev revealed that a total of 80 villages had disappeared from the map of Kazakhstan over the past two years during a roundtable discussion on rural development in the Mazhilis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Eighty villages. That's, um, that's a lot, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Eighty villages. That's, um, that's a lot, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: It is a lot! People are leaving rural areas completely for the cities. That’s what’s fueling this whole "rubber apartment" thing. It's not just a small problem, it's systemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is a lot! People are leaving rural areas completely for the cities. That's what's fueling this whole rubber apartment thing. It's not just a small problem, it's systemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article mentions that the population is moving to major cities, leading to the "rubber apartment" problem, and separately mentions that 80 villages have disappeared. It does not explicitly state that the disappearance of villages is what is fueling the "rubber apartment" issue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: So the government is just, like, trying to put a band-aid on the city problem instead of, I don't know, addressing why people are leaving the villages?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So the government is just, like, trying to put a band-aid on the city problem instead of, I don't know, addressing why people are leaving the villages?

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, they're tightening penalties for owners who, uh, don't follow the rules. It's an administrative offense now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, they're tightening penalties for owners who, uh, don't follow the rules. It's an administrative offense now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government also proposes stricter penalties for property owners who register individuals who do not actually reside in their apartments or fail to remove people from registration in a timely manner. These amendments will be included in the Code of Administrative Offenses...

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Right. More rules. More penalties. That'll fix everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. More rules. More penalties. That'll fix everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: But it's about, like, trying to manage urban sprawl and, um, actual infrastructure, too. If you have all these people registered but not actually there, it messes with everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's about, like, trying to manage urban sprawl and, um, actual infrastructure, too. If you have all these people registered but not actually there, it messes with everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: I guess. It just sounds like, you know, another policy that’ll get gamed eventually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess. It just sounds like, you know, another policy that'll get gamed eventually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_1
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe, but, like, it's a symptom of a much bigger, country-wide demographic shift. That's the real story here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe, but, like, it's a symptom of a much bigger, country-wide demographic shift. That's the real story here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: speaker_2
dialogue_turns.text: Or, uh, just another day in bureaucracy, I don't know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, uh, just another day in bureaucracy, I don't know.
